question: We split testing into distinct stages primarily because:
options: Each test stage has a different purpose.
It is easier to manage testing in stages.
We can run different tests in different environments.
The more stages we have, the better the testing.

question: Which of the following is likely to benefit most from the use of test tools providing test capture and replay facilities?
options: Regression testing
Integration testing
System testing
User acceptance testing

question: Which of the following statements is NOT correct?
options: A minimal test set that achieves 100% LCSAJ coverage will also achieve 100% branch coverage.
A minimal test set that achieves 100% path coverage will also achieve 100% statement coverage.
A minimal test set that achieves 100% path coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% statement coverage.
A minimal test set that achieves 100% statement coverage will generally detect more faults than one that achieves 100% branch coverage.

question: Which of the following requirements is testable?
options: The system shall be user friendly.
The safety-critical parts of the system shall contain 0 faults.
The response time shall be less than one second for the specified design load.
The system shall be built to be portable.

question: For the ticket pricing procedure, what is the minimum number of tests needed to ensure all questions are asked, all combinations occur and all replies given?
Error guessing:
options: supplements formal test design techniques.
can only be used in component, integration and system testing.
is only performed in user acceptance testing.
is not repeatable and should not be used.

question: Which of the following is NOT true of test coverage criteria?
options: Test coverage criteria can be measured in terms of items exercised by a test suite.
A measure of test coverage criteria is the percentage of user requirements covered.
A measure of test coverage criteria is the percentage of faults found.
Test coverage criteria are often used when specifying test completion criteria.

question: In prioritizing what to test, the most important objective is to:
options: find as many faults as possible.
test high risk areas.
obtain good test coverage.
test whatever is easiest to test.

question: Which of the following pairs of test management terms and activity descriptions is correct?
Which one of the following statements about system testing is NOT true?
options: System tests are often performed by independent teams.
Functional testing is used more than structural testing.
Faults found during system tests can be very expensive to fix.
End-users should be involved in system tests.

question: Which of the following is false regarding incidents?
options: Incidents should always be fixed.
An incident occurs when expected and actual results differ.
Incidents can be analyzed to assist in test process improvement.
An incident can be raised against documentation.

question: Enough testing has been performed when:
options: time runs out.
the required level of confidence has been achieved.
no more faults are found.
the users won't find any serious faults.

question: Which of the following is NOT true of incidents?
options: Incident resolution is the responsibility of the author of the software under test.
Incidents may be raised against user requirements.
Incidents require investigation and/or correction.
Incidents are raised when expected and actual results differ.

question: Which of the following is not described in a unit test standard?
options: syntax testing
equivalence partitioning
stress testing
modified condition/decision coverage

question: Which of the following is false regarding reliability and debugging?
options: In a system two different failures may have different severities.
A system is necessarily more reliable after debugging for the removal of a fault.
A fault need not affect the reliability of a system.
Undetected errors may lead to faults and eventually to incorrect behavior.

question: Which one of the following statements, about capture-replay tools, is NOT correct?
options: They are used to support multi-user testing.
They are used to capture and animate user requirements.
They are the most frequently purchased types of CAST tool.
They capture aspects of user behavior.

question: How would you estimate the amount of re-testing likely to be required?
options: Metrics from previous similar projects
Discussions with the development team
Time allocated for regression testing
a & b

question: Which of the following is true of the V-model?
options: It states that modules are tested against user requirements.
It only models the testing phase.
It specifies the test techniques to be used.
It includes the verification of designs.

question: The oracle assumption:
options: is that there is some existing system against which test output may be checked.
is that the tester can routinely identify the correct outcome of a test.
is that the tester knows everything about the software under test.
is that the tests are reviewed by experienced testers.

question: Which of the following characterizes the cost of faults?
options: They are cheapest to find in the early development phases and the most expensive to fix in the latest test phases.
They are easiest to find during system testing but the most expensive to fix then.
Faults are cheapest to find in the early development phases but the most expensive to fix then.
Although faults are most expensive to find during early development phases, they are cheapest to fix then.

question: Which of the following should NOT normally be an objective for a test?
options: To find faults in the software.
To assess whether the software is ready for release.
To demonstrate that the software doesn't work.
To prove that the software is correct.

question: Which of the following is a form of functional testing?
options: Boundary value analysis
Usability testing
Performance testing
Security testing

question: Which of the following would NOT normally form part of a test plan?
options: Features to be tested
Incident reports
Risks
Schedule

question: Which of these activities provides the biggest potential cost saving from the use of CAST?
options: Test management
Test design
Test execution
Test planning

question: Which of the following is NOT a white box technique?
options: Statement testing
Path testing
Data flow testing
State transition testing

question: Data flow analysis studies:
options: possible communications bottlenecks in a program.
the rate of change of data values as a program executes.
the use of data on paths through the code.
the intrinsic complexity of the code.

question: In the tax calculation system, which is a valid Boundary Value Analysis test case?
An important benefit of code inspections is that they:
options: enable the code to be tested before the execution environment is ready.
can be performed by the person who wrote the code.
can be performed by inexperienced staff.
are cheap to perform.

question: Which is the best source of Expected Outcomes for User Acceptance Test scripts?
options: Actual results
Program specification
User requirements
System specification

question: What is the main difference between a walkthrough and an inspection?
options: An inspection is lead by the author, whilst a walkthrough is lead by a trained moderator.
An inspection has a trained leader, whilst a walkthrough has no leader.
Authors are not present during inspections, whilst they are during walkthroughs.
A walkthrough is lead by the author, whilst an inspection is lead by a trained moderator.

question: Which one describes the major benefit of verification early in the life cycle?
options: It allows the identification of changes in user requirements.
It facilitates timely set up of the test environment.
It reduces defect multiplication.
It allows testers to become involved early in the project.

question: Integration testing in the small:
options: tests the individual components that have been developed.
tests interactions between modules or subsystems.
only uses components that form part of the live system.
tests interfaces to other systems.

question: Static analysis is best described as:
options: the analysis of batch programs.
the reviewing of test plans.
the analysis of program code.
the use of black box testing.

question: Alpha testing is:
options: post-release testing by end user representatives at the developer's site.
the first testing that is performed.
pre-release testing by end user representatives at the developer's site.
pre-release testing by end user representatives at their sites.

question: A failure is:
options: found in the software; the result of an error.
departure from specified behavior.
an incorrect step, process or data definition in a computer program.
a human action that produces an incorrect result.

question: In the tax calculation system, which group of numbers would fall into the same equivalence class?
The most important thing about early test design is that it:
options: makes test preparation easier.
means inspections are not required.
can prevent fault multiplication.
will find all faults.

question: Which of the following statements about reviews is true?
options: Reviews cannot be performed on user requirements specifications.
Reviews are the least effective way of testing code.
Reviews are unlikely to find faults in test plans.
Reviews should be performed on specifications, code, and test plans.

question: Test cases are designed during:
options: test recording.
test planning.
test configuration.
test specification.

question: A configuration management system would NOT normally provide:
options: linkage of customer requirements to version numbers.
facilities to compare test results with expected results.
the precise differences in versions of software component source code.
restricted access to the source code library.
